messages.content: I was working with a colleauge to work on a collective grant between 3 organizations. She had to leave the team and I was responsible to follow up. I'm months late and I'm not sure how to email the others and start the process again. How can I come clean without ruining my reputation or making false excuses. I had to take on extra roles and I couldn't keep up

Subject: Request to Reconvene on Joint Grant Initiative

Dear [Recipient's Name],

I hope this message finds you well. I wanted to provide you with an update and discuss the next steps regarding our joint grant initiative.

Firstly, I must offer my sincere apologies for the delay in communication and progress on our shared project. After my colleague's departure, I was assigned to several additional responsibilities, and I must admit, the juggling act proved more challenging than I anticipated. As a result, I was unable to devote the necessary time and energy to our grant project, and for that, I apologize.

I understand and respect the significance of this project for all of our organizations, and I genuinely regret any inconvenience caused by this delay. Please rest assured that it was never my intention to stall our joint initiative.

Moving forward, I am fully committed to bringing this project back on track and catching up on lost time. To this end, I propose to reconvene at the earliest convenient date for all parties involved so we can revisit our goals, realign our strategies, and redefine our timelines. I am eager to listen to your feedback, suggestions, and any concerns you may have.

Again, I am truly sorry for any disruptions caused and appreciate your understanding and patience in this matter. Our shared mission is of utmost importance, and I am confident that by working together, we can successfully navigate through these challenges and achieve our common goals.

Thank you for your understanding, and I look forward to your reply.

Best regards,
[Your Name]

see. It sounds like you took on additional responsibilities that made it difficult to keep up with following up on this grant collaboration in a timely manner. Here is what I would suggest:


Be honest but tactful. Explain the situation truthfully without making excuses. You can say something like:


"I apologize for the delay in moving forward with our grant proposal collaboration. I took on some additional roles over the last few months that made it challenging for me to keep up with our initial plans."


Take responsibility. Acknowledge that you dropped the ball and own up to it. For example:


"I realize I should have made more of an effort to keep things moving ahead and stay on top of next steps. I take full responsibility for the lack of progress."


Reaffirm your commitment. Express your continued interest in and commitment to the partnership and grant proposal. For example:


"Despite the delay, I remain fully committed to this collaboration and grant proposal. This initiative is important, and I want to ensure we get things back on track."


Outline next steps. Propose some concrete next steps to restart progress and get the planning back on schedule. Ask others for their input and buy-in. For example:


"Where would you like to re-start from? Shall we revisit initial discussions around partner roles and the overall proposal outline? Let me know if you have any other suggestions on how we can efficiently move forward from here."


Commit to better follow through. Let your colleagues know that a lack of follow through won't happen again. For example: "Again, I apologize for dropping the ball. You have my word that I will make this a priority going forward and ensure proper follow up and progress."

Subject: Rekindling Our Joint Grant Initiative - Sincere Apologies and Proposed Next Steps 

Dear [Recipient's Name],

I hope this message finds you well and in good spirits. 

I am writing to discuss our joint grant initiative that has been awaiting progression. I would like to begin by extending my sincere apologies for the delay that has occurred over the past few months. In the wake of my colleague's departure, I was asked to take on additional roles which proved to be quite challenging to balance, and our shared project unintentionally fell to the wayside as a result. 

I fully acknowledge my responsibility in this lack of progress, and I deeply regret any inconveniences this might have caused to you and the organization. It was not my intention to stall our joint efforts, and I assure you this lapse was out of the ordinary for me.

Please know that despite this delay, my commitment to our partnership and this grant proposal remains unshaken. The importance and potential impact of this initiative are not lost on me, and I am fully prepared to put in the necessary effort to bring us back on track. 

To that end, I propose we schedule a meeting at the earliest convenient time for all parties to revisit our objectives, discuss our roles, and reestablish our project timelines. Your input and suggestions on how we can efficiently move forward from here would be highly appreciated.

I want to reaffirm my dedication to this project and ensure such a lack of follow-through does not occur again. From now on, I commit to making this initiative a priority, guaranteeing proper follow-up and sustained progress. 

Once again, I sincerely apologize for any disruptions caused and thank you for your understanding and patience. I believe that with our collective efforts, we can successfully navigate these hiccups and achieve our shared goals.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
